body_html: I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix the issue though (see above). If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match exactly. It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based solution.
body_text:
I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest
stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix
the issue though (see above).

If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel
minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match
exactly.

It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we
rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and
error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before
executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based
solution.
body:
I bet you are testing TF at head, which works. This is about the latest
stable (released) version of TF. Apparently, the flag alone does not fix
the issue though (see above).

If you guarantee no breaking changes for patch, we can check for Bazel
minor version in configure and issue a stern warning if it doesn't match
exactly.

It's a little sad because I'd love to get rid of configure and the less we
rely on it the better. The problem is that the compatibility check and
error message inside our build files is useless if Bazel dies before
executing it. That happened before, so we went back to a configure based
solution.
